title.narrative: IOM Humanitarian Support 2017-2020
IOM Humanitärt Stöd 2017-2020

description.narrative: IOM works to help ensure the orderly and humane management of migration, to promote international cooperation on migration issues, to assist in the search for practical solutions to migration problems and to provide humanitarian assistance to migrants in need, including refugees and internally displaced people. The IOM constitution recognises the link between migration and economic, social and cultural development, as well as to the right of freedom of movement. The reason for this amendment (9) is to support a second phase of the JIAF project, which aims at improving quality and efficiency of the humanitarian system. The specific objective of the JIAF is to enable the analysis of the various dimensions of a crisis (context, impact and humanitarian conditions) and its underlying factors, as well as the resulting effects on people’s lives and livelihoods combining multiple sectors and their interactions.

Detta är ett kompletterande insatsbeslut till avtal med IOM om bidrag till humanitära insatser 1 april 2018-31 mars 2019. Beslutat tas i enlighet med Sidas insatshanteringsregel paragraf 3.11.3 och avser det andra året av ett treårigt avtal.
IOM medges fortsatt flexibilitet att omallokera medel inom en projektbudget på upp till 10% mot total godkänd projektbudget. Detta bedöms vara nödvändigt för att IOM på ett relevant, snabbt och ändamålsenligt sätt kunna möta humanitära behov. För ändringar över 10% i förhållande till godkänd projektbudget så krävs Sidas godkännande innan ändringen görs.
Vidare så bedömer Sida att samtliga medel för projektet ska utbetalas ut omgående för att möjliggöra planering och uppstart av projekten till 1 april 2018. Detta för att på bästa sätt möjliggöra planering och genomförande av den humanitära insatsen utan fördröjning. Ett avsteg från Sidas vanliga rutiner om uppdelade betalningar bedöms motiverat.
Bedömningspromemorian har skrivits på engelska med anledning av att engelskspråkig personal i fält är delaktig i beredning och uppföljning av insatsen, i enlighet med Generaldirektörens beslut om språkvalsmatris med tillämpningsanvisningar från den 1 mars 2013.
Tillägg 5 MSEK juli 2021 i stöd till JIAF projektet. Aktivitet löper tills 31 augusti 2022.
De landinriktade stöden är avslutade och kvarstår gör stödet till metodutvecklingsprojektet JIAF om 1 MSEK. Insatsens aktiviteter löper till och med juni 2023.

This is a suplementary decision to the agreement with IOM on support to humanitariain interventions 1 April 2018-31 March 2019. The decision is taken based on Sida's internal rule on contribution management paragraph 3.11.3 and is the second year of a three year agreement.
The contribution to IOM is to humanitarian aid projects directed to internally displaced people and migrants, including in some cases voluntary returnees with humanitarian needs and in humanitarian crises returning form neighbouring countries. The support is designed as stand-alone projects in countries where IOM has a comparative advantage and their proposed initiative has been deemed appropriate to respond to the country's most urgent humanitarian needs. IOM has a unique mandate to work with migrants and by that also targets internally displaced persons and returnees who are not targeted by other organisations. Migrants generally also have protection needs because of vulnerability related to travel. IOM has also presents a clear link between humanitarian and development issues. IOM works with migration through a multisectoral approach to assist vulnerable migrants with everything from shelter, protection to food and non-food support. IOM also has a satisfactory experience of integrating gender, conflict and environment / climate in their processes. IOM has since the previous agreement entered into agreements with the UN and is now a UN related organisation that gives it access to more forums in the United Nations. IOM interventions continues to be organised in project form which allows appeals support or core support from Sida is not possible at present. This appraisal is mainly written in English to enable NPOs to access the document.
Additional 5 MSEK funding granted to IOM in july 201 in support to JIAF project that will run until 31 August 2022.
The country specific support are concluded. A support to the methods project JIAF remains with an amount of MSEK 1. The activity period comes to an end in June 2023.

tag.narrative: 10.7 - Facilitate orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility of people, including through the implementation of planned and well-managed migration policies.
10.7 - Underlätta en ordnad, säker, reglerad och ansvarsfull migration och rörlighet av personer, inklusive genom planerad och väl fungerande migrationspolitik.

2021-001466, Decision on Amendment of Contribution (10287) nr 9 IOM 2970114
Results achieved
Uppnådda resultat

description.narrative:
The JIAF was established formally during 2019 and started its more operational work during 2020. It has developed a workplan that is being implemented according to plan. So far the project has set up a governance structure with technical groups, a joint advisory group and a steering committee. It has also established a programme management unit (PMU) who manages the day to day work. The PMU is hosted by OCHA but staff are contracted by IOM. The PMU has 4 staff members of which some are on loan from other agencies or financially supported by other agencies/donors. Other important results during the process is the actual development of the JIAF tool 1.0, the testing of the tool in initially 20 countries, fine tuned into JIAF 1.1 and further used in 27 countries. Further results are the external review of the tool done by the Yale University. Moreover, the project has conducted a number of training activities for the roll out of the tool and for country teams on how to use the tool. The most important and the more qualitative result is that in the 27 countries that during HPC 2021 and 2022 tested the tool, the users have confirmed that the quality of the needs assessments have improved. Despite the improvements of the assessments some challenges have been raised and it has now been decided to further develop the tool to a JIAF 2.0 that should be rolled out for the 2024 HPC. For HPC 2024 a fully developed JIAF 2.0 is anticipated to be in place.
IOM has submitted the reports on the JIAF project in time and they are of good quality. The collaboration with the PMU has been excellent.
